{"id":1251838256,"question_id":2871,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 month, 2 weeks","timestamp":1715093222,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1251838256/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Double a Number Represented as a Linked List","memory":"47.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * public class ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode next;\n *     ListNode() {}\n *     ListNode(int val) { this.val = val; }\n *     ListNode(int val, ListNode next) { this.val = val; this.next = next; }\n * }\n */\nclass Solution {\n    public ListNode doubleIt(ListNode head) {\n        head = reverseIt(head);\n\n        ListNode node = head;\n        boolean carry = false;\n        while (node != null) {\n            if (node.val > 4) { // results in double digit\n                node.val = 2 * node.val - 10;\n                if (carry) {\n                    node.val++;\n                }\n                if (node.next == null) {\n                    node.next = new ListNode(0);\n                }\n                carry = true;\n            } else {\n                node.val *= 2;\n                if (carry) {\n                    node.val++;\n                }\n                carry = false;\n            }\n            node = node.next;\n        }\n\n        return reverseIt(head);\n    }\n\n    private ListNode reverseIt(ListNode oldHead) {\n        ListNode newHead = oldHead;\n        ListNode node;\n        while (oldHead.next != null) {\n            node = oldHead.next;\n            oldHead.next = node.next;\n            node.next = newHead;\n            newHead = node;\n        }\n        return newHead;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"double-a-number-represented-as-a-linked-list","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
